page.title: 05The village of PLAXTOL
page.content:
The village of Plaxtol has a{ {population}of about 1200 people. It is situated on the western slopes of the Bourne Valley, 5 km north of the town of{Tonbridge}in Kent.
Half a dozen shops, a pub and a restaurant form the centre of the village. Its houses have been build along the lanes which criss-cross the hillside.
Plaxtol is in the middle of an area of mixed farming and many of the people who lived here before World War 2 worked either on the land or in service at one of several large houses to be found in the area. In 1985, most of Plaxtol's working{population} are either employed in nearby towns or commute daily to London.
